page.title: 12BULCOTE-MEDIA
page.content: The main item of news this week, 17,6,85 - 21,6,85.was the murder in Burton Joyce of a pig farmer, Mr.William Herbert Straw.Mrs. Nora Straw found her husband's dead body at the rear of their smallholding in Occupation Road.She said that she and her husband had gone to investigate a disturbance when they found that some pigs had escaped.She left her husband to return the pigs to their sty and went indoors.When her husband did not return,at 12.55a.m. Mrs. Straw went to look for him.It was then that she found the body.The inquest was adjourned pending the outcome of criminal proceedings.Philip Carney aged 19 of no fixed address and Jason Crisellage 19 from Colwick have been remanded in prison custody charged with the murder.There was no application for bail.
